title: SWITCH_TO_MULTI_FIRSTPART
content:
0xAAB3200ED59016BC0xFB4D062D// SwitchToMultiFirstpart
void SWITCH_TO_MULTI_FIRSTPART(Ped ped, int flags, int switchType);Parameters:ped: The Ped (player character) for which the switch is initiated.flags: Flags control various functionalities: 0 for normal behavior, 1 for no transition, and 255 for Switch IN.switchType: Specifies the type of switch (0 - 3): 0 for 1 step towards ped, 1 for 3 steps out from ped, 2 for 1 step out from ped, and 3 for 1 step towards ped.You can check if the player is in a Switch state with IS_PLAYER_SWITCH_IN_PROGRESS.*Note: Doesn't act normally when used on Mount Chiliad.*Old name:  _SWITCH_OUT_PLAYERExamples:LuaJavaScriptC#-- Check if the player is in a Switch "state"
if not IsPlayerSwitchInProgress() then
    -- If the player is not already in a Switch state, initiate a Switch
    SwitchToMultiFirstPart(PlayerPedId(), 0, 1)
    -- In this case, switchType is set to 1, which means "3 steps out from ped"
end
codeBlocks:
// SwitchToMultiFirstpart
void SWITCH_TO_MULTI_FIRSTPART(Ped ped, int flags, int switchType);

-- Check if the player is in a Switch "state"
if not IsPlayerSwitchInProgress() then
    -- If the player is not already in a Switch state, initiate a Switch
    SwitchToMultiFirstPart(PlayerPedId(), 0, 1)
    -- In this case, switchType is set to 1, which means "3 steps out from ped"
end
